title: What is meant by a viable business idea? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am currently reading Peter Thiels Zero to One which is all about this, Im going to reference a few things from his writings. Basically a viable business idea is one that will suceed and dominate it’s market. Alphabet(Google) Dominates the online advertising market and the search engine market Amazon controlled the online book market nearly making bookstores absolute Henry Ford revolutionized transportation and then dominated the industry for a while. What’s so alike about these companies or people that set themselves apart from the failures. They created something new, they invented their own market or dominated one with little competition. You may be saying, “Hey why make a company in a market worth $1Mil when the car industry is worth billions!” Well do the math, you may control .5 percent of the car industry but that means you are earning $5Mil not including production costs and upkeep for your buisness. Thats not even saying you will be crushed by the massivd corperations that control the market. However if you start off in a smaller market or create you’re going to have a lot of control and presence. You can even expand in the market. The idea here is not to shadow and follow the giants, theyre idea of sucess may have worked for them when their market of operations was small and ready to be worked. Now you will fail and flownder. Creating your own market or targeting a small one will increase your success.

A viable business idea means an idea that you can implement in real life as well as can generate considerable profits from it. For example, you want to become an entrepreneur. You have a few great ideas for business, and you’re really excited to implement them. Wait a second and rethink… are you sure your ideas are implementable in real life? Do you know the tools, support, manpower you will need to implement the idea? Are you sure you will be able to make enough profit from the implementation of idea for a considerably long term period? If all your answers of the above questions is YES, you can call it a viable business idea.
